question: Subject: 4yr old CAH male with frequent urinationForum: The Urology Forum:The pituitary gland controls vasopressin.  If the gland isdamaged and not producing vasopressin, the same damage couldcause a lack of ATCH as well.  This would give rise to apparentadrenal problems when in fact they are pituitary in origin.  Thissame problem will show up later at puberty with a lack oftestosterone.I know that you are not an Endo but I certainly appreciate you assistance with this.I am very concerned about my son.  I have always been told that my son producesan abundance of testosterone because of the lack of production of cortisone andaldosterone.  This is why his is given florinef and cortef to lower the productionof the testosterone.  Based on this I am a bit curious about your comment aboutthe lack of testosterone during puberty.  One last question... would a simplefinger ***** blood test for diabetes show diabetes insipidus?  Or is there a differenttype of test that sould be done?Thanks again for your helpFollow Ups:Re: 4yr old CAH male with frequent urination don 2/23/1999(0)Re: 4yr old CAH male with frequent urination don 2/23/1999(1)4yr old CAH male with frequent urination Judy 2/23/1999(0)
